intro: Werneria pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved werneria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, pinnately divided leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
